So? This isn't real blood, it's drawn, but that isn't even what bothers me the most, let them have the splash without blood, I don't care about them, but don't force some retarded rule on me, who is half a world away from them.

But this isn't about you. It is about everyone getting the same experience, but since one country has laws about the acceptability of blood gushing out of people, it had to be censored. Yes it would be more fun if we could just completely ignore other peoples cultures and pander only to ourselves, but that is not how the world works. Does the absence of the blood really affect you **that** much?

Why, though, must everyone get the same experience? I don't want to ignore other people's cultures, but cartoon violence is a fun and enjoyable part of the game. I enjoy replicating violent actions in a fantasy world--that's part of the reason I play video games. This censorship DOES remove an important game-play experience from us. Why should more liberal countries be forced to have the same censorship that more conservative ones have? Their social mores are not my social mores.

The champions are meant to be characters, with personalities. Drug, alcohol and tobacco use, along with sex and violence, are pretty normal parts of the human experience. It's not ridiculous to want a full spectrum of personalities expressed in our splash arts, especially when these things are a HUGE part of the champion's identity to begin with. (Vlad and blood? Graves and his cigar?) Some skins you buy specifically because you like the splash art.

I personally think that maxing out the enjoyability of each region is more important than unifying our art experience. I don't honestly care what the Koreans' splash art looks like. The boards are our space to say that. It isn't about OP, it's about everyone that enjoys cartoon violence in their video games, paid good money for it, and is now having it taken away from us like we're brainless children.
